alert.note: Alert for Susquehanna (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 10:30AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong cluster of thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Susquehanna and north central Lackawanna Counties through 1115 AM EDT... At 1029 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong cluster of thunderstorms near Harford, or 11 miles southeast of Montrose, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Clifford, Susquehanna, Susquehanna Depot, Harford, New Milford, Ararat, Lanesboro, Hop Bottom and Thompson. This includes the following highway exits... Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 202 and 223. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
